intro: Cacalia compacta, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens and small landscape spaces. The flowers are usually blue or violet in color, adding a striking visual element to the garden.
